comment.author: 48889055628@N01
comment._content: Billy Sunday (1862-1935) was a popular baseball player with the Chicago White Stockings from about 1885 to 1897.  After his sports career was over, he went on to become an equally popular and influential Christian evangelist.  He was a figure in the Temperance movement and played a significant role in advocating for the 18th amendment (Prohibition).
